title: Practice – Sentence Pattern B (Subject + Direct Object + Verb)
goals: Identify and translate Pattern B sentences (Subject + Direct Object + Verb)

steps.speak: Salve! Welcome to Week 13 Day 2. Yesterday we learned Pattern A: Subject + Verb. Today we add a direct object – the thing receiving the action.
Example one: Puella amat – The girl loves. But if we say Puella rosam amat, we add ‘the rose’. Puella (loves whom?) the rose.
Repeat: Puella rosam amat – The girl loves the rose. Say each word slowly.
Notice the ending –am in rosam. That tells us it’s accusative, the receiver of the action.
Try another: Puer aquam portat – The boy carries the water.
Ask together: Who is doing the action? What is receiving it?
Excellent! Chant the accusative endings: -a → -am, -us → -um. Say it three times.
Mini quiz time: Translate ‘Agricola puerum videt.’
Answer – The farmer sees the boy. Optime!
Faith phrase: Verbum Dei verum est – The Word of God is true. Each sentence we translate is also a little truth.
Virtue reflection – Truth means seeing clearly and speaking accurately. When we translate well, we practice Veritas.
Tomorrow we learn two new patterns that link and give.
